args:
With the Halidom attacked by living corpses.
Yachiyo's brother-in-law, Saiga, shows up to offer
aid and explain that the enemy's objective is a
scroll in Yachiyo's possessionâ€”a scroll that
contains the location of the Underworld Key.
Saiga then urges Yachiyo to give him the scroll.
So you showed your ugly mug at last.
Anything you want to say, bub?
As I told you, there is little meaning\nin our exchanging words.
In that case, I'm going to consider our past\nover, and you officially dead to me.
Let's go, Saiga. You and me,\nmano a mano!
A few days prior, at the Halidom...
We've taken out a bunch of 'em, but they\ndon't even seem to care! What the hell is\nup with these creepy weirdos?!
These chumps here must be the living\ncorpses I keep hearing folks jaw about.
Could be another invasion attempt by the\nEmpire, or it could it be a whole other\nball of wax altogether...
Do you know that man, Yachiyo?
Sure do! He's my brother-in-law.\nEr, but there's something about him\nthat doesn't seem quite right...

I've not time for idle discourse. Yachiyo,
I ask you to give me the scroll in your
possession which details the location
of an Underworld Key.

Let's just slow down there, bub.
I ain't seen you in a dog's year,
so before you start barkin' orders,
maybe give me the what-for first.
Wasn't the Underworld Key that thing\nthe Mukuroshu were after?
That gaggle of creeps we fought back\naround New Year's awhile back?\nI HATE those guys!

That's right, they were trying to create an
Underworld Key here at the Halidom so
they could open up a gateway to the
Realm of the Dead.
Are you claiming the attack we fended\noff earlier was their doing?
Yes. Every living corpse you sent back to\nthe grave was sent by the Mukuroshu.
Rather than attempting to create a new key\nfrom nothing, this attack was designed to\nsteal one that already exists.
And you think that scroll thingie Yachiyo\nhas will point the way to it?

That scroll comes from my grandpappy.
He was a real wisehead with the written
word, that oneâ€”always whippin' up books
on martial arts and the like.
Never thought the Mukuroshu would be\ninterested in Grandpappy's chicken scratch,\nbut now that I think about it... Hrmm...
I take it you have at least some idea.

My teacherâ€”Yachiyo's grandfatherâ€”was a
great man, trusted by the shogunate and
tasked directly with the protection of an
Underworld Key.
During his life, he hid his key away in a\nplace where none could find it, and its\nlocation remains a secret to this day.

The Mukuroshu have already ransacked
his former home in their search for it,
as well as a number of other locations,
but their efforts have borne no fruit so far.

Well, ain't that a kick in the teeth!
I just took the dang thing with me so I
had something to remember the old
buzzard by.
The Mukuroshu and I only became aware\nof the scroll's existence after you departed\nHinomoto.
I followed you as you traveled the world\ndueling strong warriors, and now our paths\nhave finally crossed in this place.

And the Mukuroshu, too, will pursue you
to the ends of the earth if they believe
there is the slightest chance of obtaining
a clue to an Underworld Key.
So why do you want little old me to fork\nit over to you like some daft schmo?
I don't wish to see my sister-in-law in\ndangerâ€”and that ends my explanation.\nNow give me the scroll.
'Cause it sticks in my craw, that's why! \nAll this stuff about Mukuroshu and you\nfeels about as right as a five-cent omelet.

If you were the fellow I once knew, I'd fork
over the goods without a second thought.
But something about you now stinks,
and I ain't gonna play the sap for it!
Something about me now keeps you\nfrom trusting me as you did long ago?

The man I once knew was righteous,
peaceful, and bright like the sun.
But you? Brother, you are a completely
different kettle of fish.
What happened to you in the years since\nyou abandoned me and Grandpappy?
Silence won't tell me jack, Jack.
If you refuse to give me the scroll,\nthere is nothing more to be done.
I shall protect you from the Mukuroshu\nand continue to persuade you until you\nare more inclined to see reason.
Hold it, bub! We ain't done here!

I've GOT to get me an exit line like that...
Still, I don't know much about what he was
on about, but he did help us out, yeah?
Likely means he's not an enemy, at least.
I think there's a lot more going on here\nthan we're aware of at the moment.
I want to believe he's no mugâ€”I really do.\nBut then I see him and...
Oh, Saiga... What have you done?
